title: Collapse threads by default and change \ key to do that manually
content:
I would like to see my emails in the inbox in threads collepsed all time. I have no such menu in "View".

I found out that I can do threads collapsed with \ key, however it is on Windows keyboard coming with AltGr + q, which is hard to do with one hand.

I have TB 128.4.0esr (64 bit). Please advise.
creator: zsolt.ruszin

title: Thunderbird stopped working
content: My Thunderbird email stopped working yesterday. I rebooted and reset my modem and still nothing. When I turn it on, it briefly says no messages found and then displays a "Welcome to Thunderbird" page. It stays like that even if I click drafts, sent mail etc.
creator: namrus16

title: Inserting a Link causes Thunderbird to hang--- Solved
content:
I am running the latest update of Thunderbird 128.4.0 When I try to insert a link over text. Thunderbird hangs. I do not have any addons so there is nothing to disable. HOWEVER when I run Thunderbird in Troubleshoot mode with the button for addons disabled --- everything works as it should! I start in regular mode and look for invisible add ons to disable but there are no add ons and no themes.

I have gone to the Trouble shoot information page. I looked at the Important modified preferences to see if any network protocol handler was set to false but there are none. I went to about.config and found several preferences 

network.protocol-handler.external-default. is set to true and other

preferences beginning with network.protocol-handler.warn-external. were set to false. Forums said to set them to true to resolve problem. I did that but it did not help.

I have cleared my cache because - why not!

I stress that if I run in troubleshoot mode things work. I have been using Thunderbird for 10 years and recently jumped from version 65 to version 128. I do not know when the insert link stopped working. Any ideas besides uninstall reinstall?


SOLVED I cleared my startup cache and that did the trick.
creator: accounting61

title: Create a distribution or group mail list
content: I have followed the instructions in help articles, and cannot see how to create a mailing list, or distribution list. The instructions tell me to open the calendar, select file or mailing list. There is no file or mailing list to select. I cannot find it anyway. I can add a contact, but no list. My account is a gmail account. Created the caldav address book, and my contact imported just fine.
creator: nealbrecht

title: Cannot Dismiss Reminders GMail Calendar
content:
Hello, currently I cannot dismiss calendar events on my GMail calendar within Thunderbird. I am being prompted every twenty minutes about an event from last week. The Dismiss and Dismiss All buttons on the reminder form do nothing.

I am using Thunderbird 128.4.0esr (64-bit). The calendar is set up through Provider for Google Calendar version 128.0.0.

(Doing nothing is an improvement over the built-in calendar, which threw an error message every time instead).

This seems to be a persistent problem many users have encountered over the years, judging by past support requests from people with the same issue. Is there any way to dismiss these notifications? If not I will be uninstalling Thunderbird and finding a different email client.
creator: aperkinsva7arp
